SEARCH
Package com.example.lotterysystemproject.Models

Class EventFirebase

java.lang.Object
com.example.lotterysystemproject.Models.EventFirebase
public class EventFirebase extends Object
Central data manager for handling event and user data. This class is designed to operate in two modes:
  • Mock Mode: (Default) Uses an in-memory collection of mock data for local development and testing. This mode does not require a Firebase connection and simulates network latency using Handlers.
  • Firebase Mode: Connects to a real Firebase Firestore and Storage backend for production use.
The mode is controlled by the static final boolean USE_FIREBASE. This class is implemented as a singleton.

    static interface 
    EventFirebase.FirebaseCallback
    A generic callback interface for Firebase operations that do not return data.
    static interface 
    EventFirebase.RegistrationsListener
    A listener interface for receiving updates to a list of registrations.

      Gets the FirebaseStorage instance.
      Returns:

    • getCollection

      public com.google.firebase.firestore.CollectionReference getCollection(String name)
      Gets a reference to a specific Firestore collection.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the collection.
      Returns:
      A CollectionReference to the specified collection.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if called while in mock mode.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(User user, EventFirebase.FirebaseCallback cb)
      Adds a user to the database. In mock mode, this simulates a successful operation after a short delay.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object to add.
      cb - The callback to handle success or failure.

    • updateUser

      public void updateUser(String userId, Map<String,Object> updates, EventFirebase.FirebaseCallback cb)
      Updates user information in the database. In mock mode, this simulates a successful operation after a short delay.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to update.
      updates - A map of fields to update.
      cb - The callback to handle success or failure.

    • getUser

      public void getUser(String userId, Consumer<User> onSuccess, Consumer<Exception> onError)
      Retrieves a user from the database. In mock mode, this returns a predefined demo user after a short delay.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to retrieve.
      onSuccess - A consumer for the retrieved User object.
      onError - A consumer for any exception that occurs.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String userId, EventFirebase.FirebaseCallback cb)
      Deletes a user from the database. In mock mode, this simulates a successful operation after a short delay.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to delete.
      cb - The callback to handle success or failure.

    • getAllEvents

      public void getAllEvents(Consumer<List<Event>> onSuccess, Consumer<Exception> onError)
      Retrieves all active events. In mock mode, this returns the list of pre-seeded mock events after a short delay.
      Parameters:
      onSuccess - A consumer for the list of Event objects.
      onError - A consumer for any exception that occurs.

    • joinWaitingList

      public void joinWaitingList(String eventId, String userId, EventFirebase.FirebaseCallback cb)
      Adds a user to an event's waiting list. In mock mode, this adds the user ID to the in-memory waiting list.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event.
      userId - The ID of the user to add to the waiting list.
      cb - The callback to handle success or failure.

    • leaveWaitingList

      public static void leaveWaitingList(Event event, String userId, EventFirebase.FirebaseCallback cb)
      Removes a user from an event's waiting list. This method only operates in mock mode.
      Parameters:
      event - The event from which to remove the user.
      userId - The ID of the user to remove.
      cb - The callback to handle success or failure.

    • listenUserRegistrations

      public void listenUserRegistrations(String userId, EventFirebase.RegistrationsListener listener)
      Listens for real-time updates to a user's event registrations. In mock mode, it adds the listener to a list and immediately returns the current mock data.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose registrations to listen for.
      listener - The listener to be notified of changes.

    • stopListeningUserRegistrations

      public void stopListeningUserRegistrations()
      Stops listening for user registration updates. In Firebase mode, this removes the Firestore listener. In mock mode, this functionality is not implemented.

    • upsertRegistrationOnJoin

      public void upsertRegistrationOnJoin(String userId, String eventId, String eventTitleSnapshot, EventFirebase.FirebaseCallback cb)
      Creates or updates a registration when a user joins an event. In mock mode, this creates a new Registration object and adds it to the in-memory list.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user.
      eventId - The ID of the event.
      eventTitleSnapshot - A snapshot of the event title at the time of registration.
      cb - The callback to handle success or failure.
